description.p: LogoRRR is a powerful desktop application designed to simplify the analysis of text files for recurring patterns.
Whether you’re searching for specific events in log files or analysing any other type of text file, LogoRRR makes the process effortless and efficient.
Key features include:

ul.li: Easy Pattern Recognition: Quickly identify recurring patterns in your text files.
Versatile Application: Perfect for log file analysis, but adaptable to any text file.
User-Friendly Interface: Designed with simplicity and ease of use in mind.

description.p: This release improves the application performance for larger files.
Introduced a Favorites feature allowing users to save and reuse common search terms across different log files, accessible via a new settings dialog.
Added Global default timestamp settings to reduce configuration effort when analyzing logs from consistent sources, accompanied by a streamlined UI.
Redesigned the Blank Page for a more modern aesthetic and updated the "About" view to include a direct link to the official website.
Revamped the LogoRRR icon, which now features a new design and a high-quality SVG version.
Modernized the search term and filter menu bar buttons and improved the overall Settings Editor interface.
Expanded distribution to support Snap, allowing Linux users to install LogoRRR directly via Snapcraft or the terminal.
Added Zip file distribution options specifically to assist Windows users and certain portable use cases.
Improved GraalVM compatibility, fixing an issue where the application would not start on some older CPU architectures.
Automated the binary upload process for Windows and Linux to simplify the release workflow on the official website.
Migrated the codebase to Scala 3, adopting the new brace-less syntax for better maintainability.
This release contains various bug fixes and brings significant enhancements to user control and visualization.
It contains customizable and reusable search term groups.
It improves visual style by displaying the number of hits for each search term.
